results.name: Agostino Depretis
results.bio: Agostino Depretis was an Italian statesman, a leftist figure in the Risorgimento who later served three times as premier of Italy.

results.name: Antoinette Bourignon
results.bio: Antoinette Bourignon was a mystic and religious enthusiast who believed herself to be the “woman clothed with the sun” (Revelations 7).

results.name: Bob Baffert
results.bio: Bob Baffert is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer who is one of the most successful trainers in American horse-racing history.

results.name: Brandon Tartikoff
results.bio: Miami Vice: Development: MTV cops meets modern-day American Casablanca: … claims that NBC chief programmer Brandon Tartikoff struck upon the idea of a crime show with a music-video aesthetic and scribbled.

results.name: Carolyn Heilbrun
results.bio: Carolyn Heilbrun was an American scholar and feminist literary critic who became known for the mystery stories she published under a pseudonym.

results.name: Charlotte E. Ray
results.bio: Charlotte E.

results.name: Chen Jiongming
results.bio: Chen Jiongming was a Chinese military leader whose support allowed Sun Yat-sen to establish in Guangzhou (Canton; 1920) the revolutionary government that later spawned both the Chinese Nationalist and.

results.name: Christoph Graupner
results.bio: Christoph Graupner was one of the principal German composers of the period of Bach and Telemann.

results.name: Constantin Brătianu
results.bio: Constantin Brătianu was a Romanian politician, head of the Liberal Party, and one of the leaders of that party’s opposition to the communist ascendancy in Romania after World War II.

results.name: Dieter Schulte
results.bio: Dieter Schulte German labour leader who served as chairman of the German Trade Union Federation (Deutscher Gewerkschaftsbund; DGB) from 1994 to 2002, best known for organizing large protest rallies.

results.name: Edmund White
results.bio: Edmund White is an American writer of novels, short fiction, and nonfiction whose critically acclaimed work focuses on male homosexual society in America.

results.name: Eduard von Bauernfeld
results.bio: Eduard von Bauernfeld was an Austrian dramatist who dominated the Vienna Burgtheater for 50 years with his politically oriented drawing room comedies.

results.name: Elmer Davis
results.bio: Elmer Davis was a news broadcaster and writer, director of the U.

results.name: Eric Betzig
results.bio: Eric Betzig is an American physicist who won the 2014 Nobel Prize for Chemistry for using fluorescent molecules to bypass the inherent resolution limit in optical microscopy.

results.name: Ernestine Rose
results.bio: Ernestine Rose was a Polish-born American reformer and suffragist, an active figure in the 19th-century women’s rights, antislavery, and temperance movements.

results.name: Ethel Lynn Beers
results.bio: Ethel Lynn Beers was an American poet known for her patriotic and sentimental verse, particularly the popular Civil War poem “The Picket Guard.

results.name: Ettore Petrolini
results.bio: Ettore Petrolini was an Italian theatrical actor and author, creator of numerous caricature sketches, and inventor of a revolutionary and anticonformist way of performing.

results.name: Flora Nwapa
results.bio: Flora Nwapa was a Nigerian novelist best known for re-creating Igbo (Ibo) life and customs from a woman’s viewpoint.

results.name: Friedrich Ferdinand, Graf von Beust
results.bio: Friedrich Ferdinand, Graf (count) von Beust was the prime minister and foreign minister of Saxony (1858–66) and of the Austrian Empire (1867–71).
